intro: Cryptantha schoolcraftii, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Hydrophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Cryptantha schoolcraftii is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert scrub ecosystems.
